text: there is a dark brown wooden cabinet. placed next to the fridge.
program:
# define variables for the kitchen cabinet and the refrigerator

KITCHEN_CABINET_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["kitchen cabinet", "kitchen cabinets"])
REFRIGERATOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["refrigerator"])

# add a constraint: it's a dark brown wooden cabinet.
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=KITCHEN_CABINET_0, condition="brown")

# add a constraint: placed next to the fridge.
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=KITCHEN_CABINET_0, anchor=REFRIGERATOR_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(KITCHEN_CABINET_0)

text: this is black chair. it is facing a keyboard.
program:
# define variables for the chair and keyboard
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair", "office chair"])
KEYBOARD_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["keyboard"])

# add a constraint: the chair is black
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="black")

# add a constraint: the chair is facing a keyboard
CONSTRAINT_OPPOSITE(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=KEYBOARD_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: it is a brown leather chair that is furthest to the left against the back wall. the chair is turned, facing to the right.
program:
# define a variable for the chair
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
WALL_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["wall"])
ROOM_CENTER = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["room center"])

# add a constraint: the chair is brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="brown")

# the chair is furthest to the left against the back wall
CONSTRAINT_FAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=ROOM_CENTER)

# near the wall
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=WALL_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: this is a brown desk. it is in front of another brown desk.
program:
# define variables for the desks
DESK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])
DESK_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])

# add a constraint: the desks are brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=DESK_0, condition="brown")
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=DESK_1, condition="brown")

# add a constraint: the target desk is in front of another brown desk
CONSTRAINT_FRONT(target=DESK_0, anchor=DESK_1)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(DESK_0)

text: this is a flip open chair. it is blue and has a net seat.
program:
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair", "bookshelf", "couch", "radiator", "shelf", "stair rail", "table", "tv stand"])

CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="blue")

SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: the washing machines are tall and white. they are located perpendicular to the blue wall.
program:
# define variables for the washing machine and the wall
WASHING_MACHINE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["washing machine", "clothes dryers"]) # washing machine and clothes dryers are synonyms
WALL_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["wall"])

# add a constraint: the washing machine is white
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=WASHING_MACHINE_0, condition="white")

# add a constraint: the wall is blue
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=WALL_0, condition="blue")

# add a constraint: the washing machine is perpendicular to the wall
CONSTRAINT_ACROSS(target=WASHING_MACHINE_0, anchor=WALL_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(WASHING_MACHINE_0)

text: this is a long table. it is in the center of the room.
program:
# define variables for the table and the room center
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table", "board", "folded table"])
ROOM_CENTER = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["room center"])

# add a constraint: the table is long
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=TABLE_0, score_func="size-x")

# add a constraint: the table is in the center of the room
CONSTRAINT_CENTER(target=TABLE_0, anchor=ROOM_CENTER)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(TABLE_0)

text: it is a blue chair. the blue chair is the second right chair of the table to the right of the door.
program:
# define the variables
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door", "doorframe"])

# add the color constraint
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="blue")

# the table is to the right of the door
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=TABLE_0, anchor=DOOR_0)

# the chair is the second right of the table, meaning there's a chair to the right of the table, and our target is to the right of that chair.
CHAIR_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=CHAIR_1, anchor=TABLE_0)
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=CHAIR_1)

# set the target
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: the chair is the closest one to the entrance door. the chair is blue with four legs.
program:
# define variables for the chair and door
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door", "doorframe"])

# The color "blue" applies only to the chair.
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="blue")

# add a constraint: the chair is the closest one to the entrance door
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=DOOR_0, score_func="distance")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

CONSTRAINT_LEFT(target=MONITOR_0, anchor=MONITOR_1)

# set the variable for the target object

FLOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["floor"])

text: the chair is the closest one to the door from the right. the chair is blue with four legs.
program:
# define variables for the chair and door
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
DOOR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["door", "doorframe"])

# since the query specifies the chair from the right, we should translate it as from the right
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=DOOR_0)

# the chair is the closest one to the door from the right
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=DOOR_0, score_func="distance")

# the chair is blue
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="blue")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: this window is on the right. it is bright.
program:
# define the window variable
WINDOW_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["window"])

# window is on the right. This means it's far to the left of the room center.
ROOM_CENTER_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["room center"])
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=WINDOW_0, anchor=ROOM_CENTER_0)

# the description 'bright' doesn't relate to any spatial information, and it doesn't represent an existing color in CSS4, so it can't be used.

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(WINDOW_0)

text: this is a white towel. it is on the bottom shelf.
program:
# define variables for the towel
TOWEL_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["towel"])

# add a constraint: the towel is white
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=TOWEL_0, condition="white")

# add a constraint: the towel is on the bottom shelf, thus it should be the object with minimal z axis coordinate
CONSTRAINT_MIN_OF(target=TOWEL_0, score_func="position-z")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(TOWEL_0)

text: this is a brown chair. it is to the right of another chair.
program:

CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
CHAIR_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])

# add a constraint: the target chair is brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CHAIR_0, condition="brown")

# add a constraint: the brown chair is to the right of another chair
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=CHAIR_1)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: this chair is located behind a rectangular table that is to the left of the low square table. the chair is the second to the left of the red seat.
program:
# The query is: "this chair is located behind a rectangular table that is to the left of the low square table. the chair is the second to the left of the red seat."
# The relevant objects are chair, table, seat

# Since table and coffee table can be used interchangeably, we will use table

#define the variables
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table", "coffee table"])
TABLE_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table", "coffee table"]) #low square table
SEAT_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["seat"])

#chair is behind the rectangular table
CONSTRAINT_BEHIND(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=TABLE_0)

#table is to the left of the low square table
CONSTRAINT_LEFT(target=TABLE_0, anchor=TABLE_1)

#define the second seat to the left
SEAT_1 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["seat"]) #seat to the left
CONSTRAINT_LEFT(target=SEAT_1, anchor=SEAT_0)

#the target chair is to the left of the left seat
CONSTRAINT_LEFT(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=SEAT_1)

#seat is red
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=SEAT_0, condition="red")

#set the target
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)
csp_desc:
1-chair (target)
3-table-coffee_table
4-seat
7-seat
2-table-coffee_table
CONSTRAINT_LEFT [target: 1-chair] [anchor: 7-seat]
CONSTRAINT_BEHIND [target: 1-chair] [anchor: 2-table-coffee_table]
CONSTRAINT_LEFT [target: 7-seat] [anchor: 4-seat]
CONSTRAINT_COLOR [target: 4-seat] [condition: red]
CONSTRAINT_LEFT [target: 2-table-coffee_table] [anchor: 3-table-coffee_table]

text: this is a folded table. its brown in color and is on the right of the entry door way.
program:
# define variables for the folded table and the entry door way.
FOLDED_TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["folded table", "table"]) # "table" is also relevant since it might refer to the same object as "folded table"

# the query does not include "entry door way" in RELEVANT OBJECT LABELS, so the "right of the entry door way" relation cannot be used.

# add a constraint: the folded table is brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=FOLDED_TABLE_0, condition="brown")

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(FOLDED_TABLE_0)

text: this is a black office chair. it is at a desk.
program:
# define variables for the office chair and the desk
OFFICE_CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["office chair", "chair"])
DESK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])

# add a constraint: the office chair is black
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=OFFICE_CHAIR_0, condition="black")

# add a constraint: the office chair is at the desk
CONSTRAINT_NEAR(target=OFFICE_CHAIR_0, anchor=DESK_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object

text: the object is a brown storage container on wheels. it is in between the white step ladder and multi colored desk.
program:
# define variables for the objects
CART_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["cart"])
STEP_STOOL_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["step stool"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# add a constraint: the object is brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=CART_0, condition="brown")

# add a constraint: the object is in between a step ladder and a multi colored desk.
# Note: "multi colored desk" cannot be translated into a single color constraint.
CONSTRAINT_BETWEEN(target=CART_0, anchors={STEP_STOOL_0, TABLE_0})

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CART_0)

text: this is a tall chair. it is to the right of the round table.
program:
# define variables for the chair and table
CHAIR_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["chair"])
TABLE_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["table"])

# add a constraint: the chair is tall
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=CHAIR_0, score_func="size-z")

# add a constraint: the chair is to the right of the table
CONSTRAINT_RIGHT(target=CHAIR_0, anchor=TABLE_0)

# set the CSP variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(CHAIR_0)

text: it is a brown desk. the brown desk is the first desk at the right side of the room.
program:
# define variable for the desk
DESK_0 = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["desk"])

# define variable for the room center
ROOM_CENTER = DEFINE_VARIABLE(labels=["room center"])

# add a constraint: the desk is brown
CONSTRAINT_COLOR(target=DESK_0, condition="brown")

# the desk is at the right side of the room
# Since we are looking at the right side of the room, it will also be near the room corner
# To define it more specifically, we define the right side of the room to be the farthest from the room center
CONSTRAINT_MAX_OF(target=DESK_0, score_func="distance-to-center")

# set the variable for the target object
SET_TARGET(DESK_0)
